title: Woman has clothes ripped from her as she's battered outside pub by 3 females
text:

A woman was left with horrific facial injuries after being battered outside a city centre pub by three women.

The woman, named only as Jade, was brutally attacked on Saturday night at a pub Cork, Ireland.

Jade said she became involved in an altercation inside the pub after a woman hit her sister.

The row then spilled out of the premises onto Winthrop Street, where Jade said her clothes were ripped off and she was pinned to the ground and kicked in the face.

In a video shared on social media, the young woman can be seen with cuts and blood on her face, Cork Beo reports.

Friends said she went into a nearby fast food outlet to try and clean herself up after the attack which left her bloodied and traumatised.

Jade told Cork 96FM: "I tried to pull one of them off my sister, she got me down on the ground and she kept hitting me."

The altercation inside the pub was broken up by security staff, but the incident continued outside on the street.

She added: "She ripped my top off. I got a kick in the face, dig in the head, my eyes were left purple.

"One of them would hit me, I'd get up, another one would hit me."

Jade has been left bloodied and bruised with black eyes. She thinks she may have lost consciousness for a while.

(Image: Getty Images)

Her family are angry that security staff outside a number of premises in the area did not help her or try to stop the attacks.

Gardai, Irish Police, have confirmed that they got a report of an assault in the early hours of Sunday morning.

A spokesman said: "Gardaí in Anglesea Street are investigating a minor assault that occurred on Winthrop Street at approximately 1:30am on Saturday 6th October 2019. A female received minor injuries. Investigation is ongoing."
description: The woman, named only as Jade, says she had her clothes torn from her and was repeatedly kicked in the face during the brutal assault in Cork, Ireland
